ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course helped me develop my understanding of the purpose and structure of a dissertation. While moving through the work of developing and workshopping the prospectus, this course also helped me to become aware of my writing habits. The workshop model facilitated discussion across our cohort that gave me fresh perspective on my work and also generated excitement and support among all of us for our projects.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course provided a great deal of structure and support for beginning the prospectus writing process. The only significant weakness with the course was the timing of it--I wish we could have started the workshop during the second semester of the second year. It felt somewhat jarring to just be starting the conversation about our dissertation's and then to move very quickly towards solidifying our projects. Perhaps in the future, the workshop can meet at least one time in the Spring of second year, to give students a sense that they should be developing a strong sense of their project over the summer, in addition to studying for exams.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
